module.p:
éirich athair a father rises –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. td. 183

éirich màthair a mother rises –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. td. 183

li.gd: Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach. [...] An ceann greise dh’éirich Calum ’na sheasamh agus thearnaich e a’ bheinn air a shocair.
li.tr: Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. [...] After a while Malcolm rose up and he descended the mountain leisurely.

li.gd: Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. Dh’éirich Màiri aig deich mionaidean an déidh seachd, ach cha do dh’éirich Calum gus an robh e fichead mionaid gu ochd. Ged a bha Calum fada gun éiridh, cha tug e ach cairteal na h-uarach air faighinn deiseil, agus thàinig e a nuas an staidhre gu a bhracaist aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd.
li.tr: Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. Mary rose at ten minutes past seven, but Malcolm didn’t rise until it was twenty minutes to eight. Although Calum was late in rising, he only took a quarter of an hour to get ready, and he came downstairs to his breakfast a five minutes to eight.
